replies.body: Soraka is an extremely high skillcap champion, not recommended for new people. If you really want to delve into the mechanical minefield that is the {{champion:16}} I'd advise extreme caution.

Soraka: main W and Q
Use blue income item instead yellow imo, Try to heal team mate after landing Q on ememy for extra healing buff apply
And keep an eye on team hp, use ult wisely

Nami: when using her healing/atk ability, make sure u know who u wanna click first, enermy or team mate, as it can skip, good for getting running enemy. Her bubble stun thingy has a small delay, so place it on enemy path instead on enemy.
Her ult is very useful in team fight, can use it to split up enemy party or chance running enemy

I am also new, and I main soraka for support, feel free to add me in game :D

Hey hey, I peaked at 4.8k MMR back in 2013 before swapping over to League to play with friends. League supports are very different to DOTA2, but the role is much more consistent in terms of gold, experience and your teamfighting ability. 

In lane, you want to help your ADC trade even or favourably with the enemy ADC, while minimising the effectiveness of your rival support. 
Soraka has great poke with her Q, you should be using this consistently to harass and gain health to heal your ADC. 
Nami is more of a waiting game. You should save your Q and poke with W. Use your Q (and E your ADC) to interrupt the enemy ADC or Support at a critical point in the trade.

Both are ridiculously spammy compared to DOTA2 supports. While you learn the game, I'd stick with Soraka - she's mechanically simple and her purpose is to keep everyone alive. Nami can be quite complex and is often required to initiate or make picks. 

Good luck :)
